      • toWsvString(s: string): WsvString
        toWsvTab
      • toWsvTab(tab: seq[seq[string]]): seq[seq[WsvString]]

module to parse and serialize texts, lines and strings by the WSV-Specification

Types

WsvDocument = ref object
  lines*: seq[WsvLine]
  encoding*: WsvEncoding
WsvEncoding = enum
  weUtf8, weUtf16
to sepcify the wsv-document encoding; currently only UTF-8 is supported! 
WsvLine = ref object
  values*: seq[WsvString]
  whitespaces*: seq[int32]
  comment*: string
WsvRow = ref object
  values*: seq[string]
  whitespaces*: seq[int32]
  comment*: string
like WsvLine but hold the data in values in 'real-string' way 
WsvString = distinct string
string value which follows the wsv value-specification e.g. contains no "\n", etc. 
WsvTable = ref object
  rows*: seq[WsvRow]         ## To hold Data in 'real-string' way

Procs

func `$`(wsvstring: WsvString): string {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}

creates a 'string'-representation from the WsvString

this is not the same as toString proc

example:

let wsvstring: WsvString = %"foo ""bar"""

assert $wsvstring == ""foo ""bar""""

assert wsvstring.toString() == "foo "bar""

func `%`(s: string): WsvString {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
proc `==`(wsvstring1, wsvstring2: WsvString): bool {....raises: [], tags: [],
    forbids: [].}
proc add(wsvstring: var WsvString; s: string) {....raises: [], tags: [],
    forbids: [].}
proc len(wsvstring: WsvString): int {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
proc newWsvDocument(lines: seq[WsvLine] = @[]; encoding: WsvEncoding = weUtf8): WsvDocument {.
    ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
proc newWsvLine(line: string = ""): WsvLine {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
proc parseLine(line: string): WsvLine {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
deprecated: there's no use-case for such a function. Why?
  • if i have already a wsc-document i parse this by praseWsvLine proc
  • if i would make any data to become wsv-data the convertion is not by line but by "string-values". Therefore we have toWsvString proc
proc parseWsvContent(txt: string): WsvTable {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
parses wsv-formated text and creates WsvTable of it 
proc parseWsvFile(fp: string): WsvDocument {....raises: [],
    tags: [RootEffect, ReadIOEffect], forbids: [].}
parses a wsv-format file-content. Calls parseWsvText proc 
proc parseWsvLine(line: string): WsvLine {....raises: [Exception],
    tags: [RootEffect], forbids: [].}

parses a line which consist of WsvString's

to parse a "string-line" to a WsvLine use parseLine proc

proc parseWsvText(txt: string): WsvDocument {....raises: [Exception],
    tags: [RootEffect], forbids: [].}
parses wsv-formated text 
proc serializeWsvDoc(wsvdoc: WsvDocument; fp: string; separator: char = '\t'): string {.
    ...raises: [Exception], tags: [RootEffect], forbids: [].}
proc toSeq(wsvline: WsvLine): seq[string] {....raises: [Exception],
    tags: [RootEffect], forbids: [].}
proc toString(s: string): string {....raises: [Exception], tags: [RootEffect],
                                   forbids: [].}
value is in "real-string-format" but has WsvString-content. 
proc toString(wsvline: WsvLine; separator: string = "\t"): string {.
    ...raises: [Exception], tags: [RootEffect], forbids: [].}
proc toString(wsvstring: WsvString): string {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}

creates a real string out of WsvString

it is not the same as $ proc look there for an example

proc toTab(wsvdoc: WsvDocument): seq[seq[string]] {....raises: [Exception],
    tags: [RootEffect], forbids: [].}
proc toWsvDoc(tab: seq[seq[string]]): WsvDocument {....raises: [Exception],
    tags: [RootEffect], forbids: [].}
proc toWsvLine(list: seq[string]): WsvLine {....raises: [Exception],
    tags: [RootEffect], forbids: [].}
proc toWsvSeq(list: seq[string]): seq[WsvString] {....raises: [Exception],
    tags: [RootEffect], forbids: [].}
proc toWsvString(s: string): WsvString {....raises: [Exception],
    tags: [RootEffect], forbids: [].}
make a string become a WsvString 
proc toWsvTab(tab: seq[seq[string]]): seq[seq[WsvString]] {....raises: [Exception],
    tags: [RootEffect], forbids: [].}
